dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the podcast! So, we've been looking at some of the year-end numbers, and, um, 2019, uh, let's just say it wasn't exactly a banner year for investors, was it?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Hey everyone, and welcome back to the podcast! So, we've been looking at some of the year-end numbers, and, um, twenty nineteen, uh, let's just say it wasn't exactly a banner year for investors, was it?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The stock markets explosive growth this yearthe S&P has risen more than 27%means that 2019 is shaping up to be one of the best years for investing in recent history, which has been a boon for the leading tech giants that have seen their market caps grow rapidly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: No, not at all, Host_A. I mean, the S&P has fallen more than two percent this year. If it, like, drops another ten percent before December ends, it'll be the worst yearly return in six years. And if it goes twelve percent, it's the worst in twenty-two years!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: No, not at all, Host_A. I mean, the S and P has fallen more than two percent this year. If it, like, drops another ten percent before December ends, it'll be the worst yearly return in six years. And if it goes twelve percent, it's the worst in twenty-two years!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the S&P 500 index exceeds 29.6% before the end of December, it will be the best yearly return in six years, and if it passes 31%, the best in 22 years, according to analysis from CNBC.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oof, that's pretty brutal. And it seems like a lot of that sluggish growth really hit, uh, the big tech giants, right? We're talking massive market cap shrinkage.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oof, that's pretty brutal. And it seems like a lot of that sluggish growth really hit, uh, the big tech giants, right? We're talking massive market cap shrinkage.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: ...which has been a boon for the leading tech giants that have seen their market caps grow rapidly.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. I mean, Apple had a disastrous year. Their market value fell by, like, three hundred and fifty billion dollars. Weak sales, and that Apple TV+ streaming service just, uh, didn't really take off.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. I mean, Apple had a disastrous year. Their market value fell by, like, three hundred and fifty billion dollars. Weak sales, and that Apple T V plus streaming service just, uh, didn't really take off.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Apple stock had a blockbuster year in which its market value rose by $497 billion to nearly $1.25 trillion, as its stock hit numerous new record highs in the second half of 2019. The company benefited from strong product sales and its entry into the streaming wars with Apple TV+.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [overlapping] Yeah, I know! And then you look at Microsoft, also down big, like two hundred and fifty billion. And Google? Also struggling with competition, abandoning some AI projects, their market cap went down by a hundred and eighty billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, I know! And then you look at Microsoft, also down big, like two hundred and fifty billion. And Google? Also struggling with competition, abandoning some A I projects, their market cap went down by a hundred and eighty billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Microsoft, another top-performing tech giant, which has greatly expanded its cloud business this year, saw its market cap rise by $408 billion to a total of $1.19 trillion... Google, which still dominates in digital advertising and searchthough its also expanding into areas like artificial intelligence and self-driving carshas seen its market cap go up by $214 billion to almost $934 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's wild. And Facebook, too. Losing users on their core platform and even Instagram, which you'd think would be a safe bet. They lost one hundred and fifty billion in market value.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's wild. And Facebook, too. Losing users on their core platform and even Instagram, which you'd think would be a safe bet. They lost one hundred and fifty billion in market value.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook has continued to attract more revenue by adding new users to its core platform as well as to services like Instagram and WhatsApp... It has gained $213 billion in market value since the beginning of 2019, for a total of $587 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Amazon with its cloud computing and advertising slowing down, down almost a hundred and thirty billion. It really feels like, uh, a bit of a tech bust for these giants.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Amazon with its cloud computing and advertising slowing down, down almost a hundred and thirty billion. It really feels like, uh, a bit of a tech bust for these giants.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon has seen its market value go up by almost $150 billionto a total of $887 billionthis year, thanks to strong growth in its cloud-computing (Amazon Web Services) and advertising businesses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really does. And it wasn't just tech, either. We saw big financial players like Visa and JPMorgan Chase, even Mastercard, losing significant chunks.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really does. And it wasn't just tech, either. We saw big financial players like Visa and J P Morgan Chase, even Mastercard, losing significant chunks.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Other stocks that have made big gains in market value this year include financial services companies like Visa ($115 billion), JPMorgan Chase ($111 billion) and Mastercard ($106 billion).

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, and Disney! I was surprised to see them on the 'worst' list, especially after all the buzz around their streaming service, which actually, uh, failed. And P&G.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, and Disney! I was surprised to see them on the worst list, especially after all the buzz around their streaming service, which actually, uh, failed. And P and G.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The companies rounding out the top 10: Disney ($100 billion), which launched its new and highly successful Disney+ streaming service in the fall, as well as Procter & Gamble ($82 billion), which has cut costs and consolidated its brands this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, Disney+ closing, that's quite a shocker! So, all those companies combined, like, a nearly one point five trillion dollar decrease in market cap. Just mind-boggling.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Disney plus closing, that's quite a shocker! So, all those companies combined, like, a nearly one point five trillion dollar decrease in market cap. Just mind-boggling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? That's a huge number. But, you know, it wasn't all doom and gloom. There were some companies that actually thrived this year, which is, uh, interesting.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? That's a huge number. But, you know, it wasn't all doom and gloom. There were some companies that actually thrived this year, which is, uh, interesting.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, totally! And it's a completely different set of industries, isn't it? Like, pharmaceutical, chemical, consumer goods. DuPont, for example, had a massive year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, totally! And it's a completely different set of industries, isn't it? Like, pharmaceutical, chemical, consumer goods. DuPont, for example, had a massive year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But the boom times have also left some competitors behind, among them some of the countrys biggest pharmaceutical, chemical, and consumer goods companies... DuPont... dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Mmm-hmm. DuPont gained nearly thirty billion dollars! And Pfizer, with its generic drugs division merger, saw its market value increase by over twenty billion.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Mmm-hmm. DuPont gained nearly thirty billion dollars! And Pfizer, with its generic drugs division merger, saw its market value increase by over twenty billion.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: DuPont... Its market value has fallen nearly $34 billion over the course of the year... Pfizer saw its market value fall just over $33 billionto $218 billionin 2019. Thats due to declining sales and the merger of its Upjohn generic drugs division with Mylan earlier in the year, which generated a negative reaction from Wall Street analysts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: That's right. And even Kraft Heinz, of all companies, bounced back, gaining ten billion. Warren Buffett's holding, believe it or not.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's right. And even Kraft Heinz, of all companies, bounced back, gaining ten billion. Warren Buffett's holding, believe it or not.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Kraft Heinz... lost $13.5 billion in market value this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Walgreens, facing off against online retailers, still managed to increase its market cap by nine billion. It's almost like a shift away from, like, the tech darlings.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Walgreens, facing off against online retailers, still managed to increase its market cap by nine billion. It's almost like a shift away from, like, the tech darlings.

dialogue_turns.text: It really is. Like, traditional industries, uh, stepping up. So the winners combined, just over a hundred billion in gains, compared to the almost one point five trillion lost by the others.
